content: Lei is a Ph.D. of the Wind Engineering Research Group at Northeastern University. His research interests include wind load modeling, random vibration and wind-induced risk assessment. He develops accelerated performance-based wind engineering framework using stochastic approximation algorithm and machine learning techniques.
summary: Lei is a Ph.D. of the Wind Engineering Research Group at Northeastern University. His research interests include wind load modeling, random vibration and wind-induced risk assessment. He develops accelerated performance-based wind engineering framework using stochastic approximation algorithm and machine learning techniques.
title: Lei Zhang

content:
A full-stack Online Learning Management application where the front end implemented by React communicates with a local MySQL database through the Java middle tier.
Functions The client built by React allows users to toggle with course components and to implement CRUD operations by sending RESTful requests to a remote server using Redux The local server hosting a MySQL database is built specifically to store data of widgets, the smallest unit of component created by users The Java middle tier handles the tractions between the client and the local database Features Bootstrap Styled React Single Page Application RESTful Web Services by Redux and Java Spring Boot Screenshots Course table Course component toggling
summary: A full-stack web application of client-server architecture
title: Online Learning Management System

content:
A full-stack web application built with Java Spring Boot and MySQL database accessed via MyBatis.
Features User register/login and profile editing User address management Session-based cart management and order generation Screenshots User login User profile User address management Shopping cart Order generation
summary: A full-stack web application by Java Spring Boot and MySQL
title: E-store Website
